p: South Americaâ€™s landcover was categorized according to GlobCover (available at http://due.esrin.esa.int/page_globcover.php), one of the most widely used in ecological studies [ 30] due to its ability to correctly describe current landcover and for its applicability to large-scale studies. The GlobCover map is a categorization of MERIS FR mosaics for the year 2009 through an automatic and regionally-tuned classification, which resulted in 22 landcover classes, 19 of which occur in South America ( S1 Fig). This landcover map follows the classes defined by the United Nations Land Cover Classification System.
